# New-MCDWorkflow

Source: `source/Private/Workspace/WorkflowEditor/New-MCDWorkflow.ps1`

## Synopsis

Creates a new workflow with default settings for the MCD Workspace editor.

## Description

Creates a new WorkflowEditorModel instance with the specified name and optional
metadata. The workflow is initialized with default settings supporting both
amd64 and arm64 architectures, version 1.0.0, and an empty steps list. This
function is used by the Workspace UI to create new workflows before adding
steps and saving to disk.

## Parameters

| Name | Type | Mandatory | Pipeline | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Name | String | Yes | No | The name of the workflow. This is a required parameter that identifies the workflow in the editor and profile directory. |
| Description | String | No | No | Optional description of what this workflow does. Should be descriptive enough to help users understand the workflow's purpose (40+ characters recommended). |
| Author | String | No | No | Optional author name or organization that created the workflow. |
| Amd64 | Boolean | No | No | Whether this workflow supports x64 architecture. Defaults to true. |
| Arm64 | Boolean | No | No | Whether this workflow supports ARM64 architecture. Defaults to true. |

## Examples

### Example 1

```powershell
New-MCDWorkflow -Name 'Custom Deployment'

Creates a new workflow named 'Custom Deployment' with default settings.
```

### Example 2

```powershell
New-MCDWorkflow -Name 'Enterprise Deployment' -Description 'Standard deployment for enterprise workstations.' -Author 'IT Team'

Creates a new workflow with full metadata.
```
